metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10203 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PowerDNS Authoritative daemon , pdns versions 4.0.x before 4.0.9, 4.1.x before 4.1.11, exiting when encountering a serial between 2^31 and 2^32-1 while trying to notify a slave leads to DoS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-lua2 - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.2.0-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.2.0-1
pdns-ixfrdist - 4.2.0-1
pdns-server - 4.2.0-1
pdns-tools - 4.2.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1').
